title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 March 2012 - XWiki
content:

07:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <+mflorea> Hi faryshta  
08:29 <faryshta> Hello mflorea . I sent a GSoC idea proposal a few days ago but the mentor is the xwiki CEO so I think I have small chances to get a response. So I am thinking about proposing myself for another project.  
08:29 <+mflorea> :) you should push for the project you like  
08:30 <faryshta> mflorea, I want to know about the Wiki Browser project.  
08:30 <+mflorea> Ludovic is busy, but will answer evetually  
08:30 <+mflorea> sure, what do you want to know  
08:31 <faryshta> You mention lots of ideas there but I don't think I understand them all. For example wiki browser is supposed to be installed and written in java or a web app?  
08:31 <ssavi> has quit  
08:32 <+mflorea> the wiki browser must be build on top of XWiki, so definitely on the web  
08:32 <+mflorea> i.e. the user will browse the wiki from the wiki  
08:32 <faryshta> mflorea, then it will need lots of ajax and ajax listeners which will have to be more about back end.  
08:33 <faryshta> mflorea, the idea is to create the UI or to create it all?  
08:33 <faryshta> For example deleting a file will need to connect the database which is simple but also easily screwable.  
08:33 <+mflorea> most of the back-end is there, in XWiki APIs, you just have to write the front end, indeed using lots of AJAX  
08:34 <+mflorea> there is already API to delete/rename/create/etc/ wiki pages and same for any other wiki entity  
08:34 <+mflorea> you just have to call it  
08:34 <faryshta> mflorea, I am cool with ajax.  
08:34 <+mflorea> great then  
08:35 <faryshta> mflorea, cool then it will be simple.  
08:35 <faryshta> mflorea, is a framework predefined? Like jquery or html5?  
08:35 <+mflorea> well :) you'll still have to learn the XWiki API and understand the relation between wiki entities, like pages, classes, objects, attachments, etc.  
08:36 <+mflorea> we use Prototype.js  
08:36 <+mflorea> so you'll have to use it  
08:36 <+mflorea> but if you know JS then it won't be a problem  
08:36 <faryshta> mflorea, ok I will study it. prototype.js includes drag and drop or am I supposed to use the browser (if any) features about it.  
08:36 <+mflorea> as for HTML5, we're not there yet, so plain HTML for now  
08:37 <+mflorea> re drag&drop, you have Scriptaculous which is build on top of Prototype.js  
08:37 <+mflorea> http://script.aculo.us/  
08:38 <faryshta> cool then I am your guy. I will start writing a new GSoC proposal. I am very good with HTML, CSS, JS, AJAX and I am good at UI design.  
08:38 <+mflorea> great  
08:39 <+mflorea> I'm looking forward  
08:40 <+mflorea> for the UI design, you can ping Caty, the other mentor for this projects, which handles the UI/UX for XWiki  
08:40 <+mflorea> she can give you great advices  
08:40 <faryshta> her nick is valica right?  
08:40 <+mflorea> yep  
08:41 <faryshta> ok if I see her online I will ask her about it.  
08:41 <+mflorea> sure

19:42 <npm> how can I get XE3.5 to accept old-style /xwiki/bin/view/ links perhaps rewriting to new-style /bin/view or as i've setup ( http://trainspodder.com --> http://trainspodder.com/xwiki/ )  
19:43 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
19:44 <npm> (context: this is hosted using jelastic cloud: http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/devs/2012-March/050044.html )  
19:46 <npm> hmm that's weird the 'www'-less form was just working... now http://www.trainspodder.com/ works as expected  
19:50 <npm> anybody know why there's a browser-dependency in handing http://trainspodder.com and "staying" on that domain rather than having xwiki interpret it as the hosting service domain  
19:52 <npm> fyi issue i'm seeing on xwiki-side is very similar to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-213
